DOC.brief_summary: This is a pilot observational study to evaluate subjects with chronic kidney disease acceptance of an alert device linked to an informational website intended to increase recognition of chronic kidney disease, and to guide patients and providers to the safe delivery of care required for this disease. Primary device was a bracelet with the alternative of a key fob with same information supplied when requested. Patients usage of the device was evaluated by survey with Likert scale as to whether the device is 0 = not useful, 1 = somewhat useful, 2 = extremely useful
DOC.brief_title: Med-alert Bracelet in Chronic Kidney Disease
DOC.detailed_description: No need for more extensive description
DOC.criteria: Persons with chronic kidney disease defined as estimated glomerular filtration rate of < 60 ml/min/1.73m2. Persons expected to be on dialysis within 6 months. Less than 18 years of age
